Name: Modify Use Case
Description: The use case describes the modification that the Inventory Admin can do.
Goal: The Inventory Admin initiates the use case. The use case presents all the modification that can be done by the Inventory Admin .
Assumptions: We assume that use Knows the results of each operation there is no go back actions.
Basic Flow: Use case begins when Inventory Admin start searching for an asset
Alt. Flow: Condition: administrator or authorised inventory user is working on waiting for approval list or waiting for execution list
Inventory user or Admin Edit the asset
Inventory user or Admin modify asset properties
Exc. Flow: Inventory Admin  asset out of inventory
Message error because asset cannot be modified
Inventory Admin does not have sufficient privileges to edit asset
Postcondition: The system state change according to modification
Notes: We suppose that Hosting system and servers support all the operations

Name: Edit Use Case
Description: The use case describes the edit operation  that the Inventory Admin can do.
Goal: The Inventory Admin initiates the use case. The use case presents the edit done by the Inventory Admin.
Assumptions: We assume that use Knows the result s of each operation there is no go back actions.
Basic Flow: Use case begins when Inventory Admin start searching for an asset
Alt. Flow: Condition: administrator or authorised inventory user is working on waiting for approval list or waiting for execution list
Inventory user or Admin Edit the asset
Exc. Flow: Inventory Admin does not have sufficient privileges to edit asset
Postcondition: The system state change according to modification
Notes: We suppose that Hosting system and servers support all the operations.

Name: Add New Asset  Use Case
Description: The use case describes the operation of adding a new asset to the inventory.
Goal: The Inventory Admin  initiates the use case. The use case presents how Inventory Admin can add new inventory asset.
Assumptions: We assume that use Knows the results of each operation there is no go back actions.
Basic Flow: Use case begins when Administrator start a new asset
Alt. Flow: None
Exc. Flow: Use case begins when Administrator  start a new asset
Type does not exist in the list
Administrator send exception request to IT to add the new type and the common properties
Notes: We suppose that Hosting system and servers support all the operations

Name: Create request Use Case
Description: The use case describes the activity of creating a new request that the User can do.
Goal: The User initiates the use case. The use case presents request process that can be done by User.
Assumptions: We assume that use Knows the results of each operation
Only basic request form is available for level 0
Requests forms provide search facilities to users levels 1, 2 and 3
Basic Flow: User type a small request text specifying asset(s) location,..
Alt. Flow: User select advanced request form
User enter asset serial number and location
User enter small text describing operation to be done
User click on submit
User select advanced request form
User enter asset serial number and location
User enter small text describing operation to be done
User can add as many assets as he wants to the list by clicking add another asset button
User click on submit
User select exception request form
User enter a text message describing the exception that occurs
User click on submit
Exc. Flow: Asset not available to be borrowed
Postcondition: A new request is pending waiting approval
Notes: We suppose that Hosting system and servers support all the operations.

Name: Returning Asset
Description: The use case describes the returning asset update  that the Inventory Admin can do.
Goal: The Inventory Admin  initiates the use case. The use case presents all the updates to the inventory  that can be done by the Inventory Admin .
Assumptions: We assume that use Knows the results of each operation there is no go back actions
Basic Flow: Use case begins when Inventory Admin start returning
Inventory Admin select asset state to available
Alt. Flow: Condition:
Use case begins when Inventory Admin start returning
Inventory Admin select asset state to damaged
Notes: We suppose that H osting system and servers support all the operations

Name: Approving Request
Description: The use case describes the approving of requests that an  Inventory Admin  can do.
Goal: The Inventory Admin  initiates the use case. The use case presents all the approval or denial of a user request  that can be done by an Inventory Admin .
Assumptions: We assume that use Knows the results of each operation
Basic Flow: Use case begins when Inventory Admin display pending request list
System display only requests that he has privileges to approve
Inventory Admin select request that he want to approve
Alt. Flow: Condition:
Use case begins when Inventory Admin display pending request list
System display only requests that he has privileges to approve
Inventory Admin select request that he want to reject
rejection  is confirmed
System send Notes: to users
Notes: We suppose that Hosting system and servers support all the operations

Name: change permissions  Use Case
Description: The use case describes the modification  that Department, Facutly or University Administrator can do to a user permissions .
Goal: The administrator  initiates the use case. The use case presents all change that can be done by the Administrators .
Assumptions: We assume that use Knows the results of each operation
Administrator knows the role of each permission on the permission list
Administrator cannot assigne permissions more than he have
Basic Flow: Use case begins when Administrator  press change permission
Alt. Flow: Condition: None
Exc. Flow: Administrator modify permissions he give permissions more than he have
Postcondition: The permissions of user are changed
Notes: We suppose that Hosting system and servers support all the operations

Name: Authentication Use Case
Description: The use case describes the authentication .
Goal: The User  initiates the use case. The use case presents authentication  operation
Assumptions: We assume that use Knows the results of each operation
Basic Flow: Use case begins user starts the application
User write user name and pas sword
User log on to application main page
Alt. Flow: None
Exc. Flow: Use case begins user starts the application
User write user name and password
Notes: We suppose that Hosting system and servers support all the operations

Name: Search
Description: The use case describes the search operation  that only authorised users can do.
Goal: The User  initiates the use case. The use case presents search and advanced search that can be done  by the User .
Assumptions: We assume that use Knows the results of each operation
Basic Flow: Use case begins when User  start fill searching field
Alt. Flow: Use case begins when User  press advanced search
Fills fields
Press submit
Search results are displayed
Exc. Flow: Use case begins when User  start fill searching field
No results are found  message is displayed
Notes: We suppose that Hosting system and servers support all the operations

Name: Create Reports  Use Case
Description: The use case describes the creation of reports  that the User  can do.
Goal:
The User  initiates the use case. The use case presents reports  that can be created  by the 
User . Three reports can be created Reports  
1.User Permission Report  
2.Request Report  
3.Assets By Location Report
Precondition: User is authorised to create reports
Assumptions: We assume that use Knows the results of each operation
Basic Flow: Use case begins when User  click on a report type
Alt. Flow: None
Notes: We suppose that Hosting system and servers support all the operations
